value.title: Introduction to data modeling in Power BI
value.excerpt: In today's video we will go through the basics of data modeling in Power BI, to get you started fast and easy!  Links to mentioned resources: Flat tables vs models power bi: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QWHE8N3AkT0  Get covid data in power bi: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4vfAz7XDuH0 or https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=r9i7CTdOsBo

value.title: Map locations using Power BI shape maps (Part 1)
value.excerpt: In this video I will show you how to use Power BI visual: Shape maps.  Have you created a country json file? Give it to David!  Link to David's blog post: https://dataveld.wordpress.com/2016/09/12/topojson-map-files-for-power-bi-shape-map/ LInk to David's github library: https://github.com/deldersveld/topojson

value.title: Part2: Get Population Growth into Power BI from Eurostat API
value.excerpt: On a previous video I showed you how to the Eurostat API works: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UwXo1OcwbAg  In today's video, we are putting theory into practice and build our first report based on Eurostat data. We will get total population and population growth and map it in Power BI.  Here are the

value.title: Power BI Tips & Tricks #08: Create subsets of your data with calculated tables in Power Bi

Calculated tables are also useful for checking your DAX measures, check the video to learn how. :)   Looking for a download file? value.title: Refresh Power BI every second or minute!
value.excerpt: In today's video I am going to show you how to refresh Power BI every minute or any interval you yet :). As with everything, there are some limitations but it doesnt require a premium license.  #curbal #powerbi  Link to the blog post: https://bigintsolutions.com/2019/03/29/refresh-power-bi-report-every-min-and-show-on-a-tv/

value.title: Running totals by subcategory in Power Query!!
value.excerpt: I showed you on last monday's video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uX3_dnb5on0 how to do running totals in power query, and in this video I will show you how to do it but by subcategory or group.  Fingers crossed I managed to explain myself!! :)  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center

value.title: Avoid the full refresh with Incremental Refresh in Power BI (Premium)
value.excerpt: Is the full refresh of Incremental Refresh taking a long time? Or, even timing out? Patrick shows you how you can avoid the full refresh and refresh each partition individually when using Power BI Premium!  Handling deletes within Incremental Refresh in Power BI: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nKVrl0ec6uE

value.title: Deployment Pipelines give you more CONTROL (Power BI Premium)
value.excerpt: With Deployment Pipelines, you can control your application life cycle stages. Keep content in sync at the different stages of your development. Power BI Premium is required.  Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/create-reports/deployment-pipelines-overview https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/create-reports/deployment-pipelines-process

value.title: Power BI Tutorial: 4 Ways To Get Data
value.excerpt: In this Power BI tutorial, Adam looks at 4 ways to get data in Power BI. This focuses on Power BI Desktop and the main storage modes - Import, DirectQuery and Live Connections to Analysis Services. If you are new to Power BI, be sure to check out this Power BI Tutorial: 4 ways to get data.   Import (Excel)

value.title: The Power BI Smart Narrative visual is INSANE AMAZING!
value.excerpt: The smart narrative visual can help tell the story in your Power BI report. Justyna Lucznik joins us to explore the visual and to illustrate how you can generate text about your data.  Make sure you have the September 2020 version of Power BI Desktop, or later.  Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/visuals/power-bi-visualization-smart-narrative
